reviewText:
UPDATE: Between the developer's defensive response and the apparently toxic culture surrounding the platform hell subgenre, I have decided to leave this review up as is.  I don't care if it's due to shoddy workmanship, creative bankruptcy or whatever.  The game sucks.

Pop quiz: How many shots does it take to kill an annoying flappy thing?

No, it's not one.  What do you think this is, a good game?

The correct answer is four.  Yeah, that's quite a lot.  The little ♥♥♥♥er's headin' right for ya, possibly while there's another obstacle you gotta dodge, and it takes four hits to kill it.  All things considered you're better off just running past without firing at all.

Yep.  In a game called Blaster Shooter GunGuy, blasting and shooting with your gun is completely pointless.  Talk about a non-indicative title.
voteText: 180 of 272 people (66%) found this review helpful 35 people found this review funny

reviewText:
This game is a standard shooter game, however it is heavily flawed.
The very first thing i saw that was horribly wrong was the main menu.
After a basic title screen with flashing instructions it greets me with a boring new / load game select screen with;
Default font. No background or imagery. And no music, which actually feels like somewhat of a relief as you will see.

- The music sounds like overused stock loops from 2006 (♥♥♥♥ING KEVIN MACLEOD MUSIC!! SERIOUSLY!?!?), and the graphics look like they were made in 5 minutes, meaning they also look stock. EDIT: recently, with the rebalance of level 1-4, i was able to make it to the first boss, which uses the exact same music the regular stages for that zone had. This is just terrible.

- The controls feel broken and confusing with the sprinting acting like a dash ability. The worst part about said sprint / dash is that to be able to use it you have to be moving already, which, when compared to how sprinting / dashing works normally in games, is just plain wrong. EDIT: The recent update with controler support did not fix tis issue, however it did make it mildly more tolerable.

- I have not played much of the game but i can say with certainty that the frogs need to be balanced as they are able to jump to my position in one leap even if i just entered it's (very large) line of sight.
EDIT: the pirate ship fight also needs to be balanced, with the boss spawning pirates too often, meaining i end up with a party of about 6/8 pirates chasing me at one time.

- Thats another thing that feels stock and childish. The enemies, the first three you encounter being a frog a bird and a scorpion. ( i THINK its a scorpion at least)

- As previously mentioned, onscreen instructions for when you die or beat a level flash on and off the screen making them hard to read.

Overall this game does not even feel like it was worth the 65p i spent on it.

2 / 10

reviewText:
Difficult is an understatement...
First three levels where fun and easy to go through, but then the fourth level came...
My gun being completely useless, having to hit those damn ducks four times before they die, while in the meanwhile cannons are shooting at me. Trying to wurm my way through, to find out there are some disappearing stairs at the end of the row, having 2 birds behind my back and 3 toads above the stairs.
And don't get me wrong I did give it a lot of tries, about a 100, if not more.. While the other maps just took me a few tries, this one was impossible.. (well.. maybe if you give it another 1000 tries)
Frustrated, Anxious, Annoyed, Don't buy this game unless ur some kind of gaming god or really really patient!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CjCtuRjXIVM

There are platform games out there for everyone, but this one isn't for me, sorry.

reviewText:
The controls are awful. The buttons you have to press are are randomly placed along the keyboard and mouse. Running makes you way faster than it should. Besides that, the first level should be a tutorial, not a full demo of what you've just put youself into.

It is pretty, and could be a good game, but the responsiveness of the controls makes it way harder than it should.

By the way, the developer should change the death font and make the blinking slower (why does it blink, anyway?), as it is really hard to read sometimes. (Maybe put a layer behind the letters to give it a little bit more contrast?)

reviewText:
Games are supposed to entertain the players not frustrate them.
Although I got this game for free, I cannot deny that this game is badly made.
The difficult controls and the ridiculous level designs make the game almost impossible to play.
The monsters are extremely hard to kill. For example, the chicken has an outrageous movement and chases the player through the whole stage. The only way to stop making it follow the player is to kill it. Furthermore, this ridiculous bird, in fact, can move through the walls sometimes making it impossible to kill.
Moreover, this game has a horrible interface. The texts in the game take up half of the game screen and it is continuously blinking, making the player's eyes sore and dizzy. I would love to ask the developers why they decided to make the texts blink for every 0.5 seconds.
If you ever get this game for free, or at an extremely cheap price, just play it until the trading cards drop so that you can make some money.

reviewText: The controls are terrible, and on a 3.2ghz quad core with 1gb graphics there are serious janks in the game every few seconds with the visuals freezing and jumping, also sprinting doesn't work correctly comes on whenever it wants even if you aren't pressing the key.  And the visuals are blocky for the speed of design, I've seen people slag off much better drawn and artistic visuals that have taken devs a long time to get right where you could put up something in mspaint with a block paintbrush in a few seconds which matches the visuals of this game. Not fun, only have such a playtime to wait for the cards to drop.\n\nNothing wrong with making a challenging platformer, but you need tight and accurate good control schemes, well designed levels and this game lacks all of those aspects, the controls do not feel tight or good and have that sloppyness which makes the game a failure the instant you start playing.

reviewText:
This is a side-scroller, inspired quite a lot by Super Meat Boy. This is not a bad thing by any means, it just means that if you didn't like that game at all, you probably will not enjoy this one either.The controls are tight enough, the sound design is competently executed, especially in the later stages, where it goes from good to great. I love the space theme music.

The bosses were a nice touch, which I really apreciated, except for the dinosaur one, who was more annoying that difficult, because there was nowhere to stand to not get hit by the claw except for the springs, which open you up for the laser attack.

The whole game has this 90s' feel, but not just because of the graphics or sounds, it's the gameplay itself, the backgrounds and the premise of the game that, while not new , kept me coming back to see its conclusion. Now that I have finished it, however, I doubt I will come back to replay it, or to try to get the trophies or the gems.

I do have minor complaints:
First of all, there are multiple characters, which is good, but they're not just reskins of GunGuy, they actually play different, in the sense that some shoot faster, some deal more damage and so on. I would like to see some sort of description for the characters, in which they're abilities are described or at least hinted at, something like Gunguy has a knack for finding chicken in unlikely places" or something like that for every character.
Secondly
date: can you please make the dissapearing platforms flicker or something before they dissapear
recommended: because it's really frustrating to jump at a platform when I start the level
hoursPlayed: only to find it vanishing below my feet.\n\nAll in all

reviewText:
I found this really tough when playing on a keyboard, the addition of controller support (no hints/tips for the controller yet but it does work!) improves things immeasurably.

It's still a basic-looking and very, very punishing platform shooter, but some people LIKE those things!?

I need to spend more time perhaps, but it's great to see a developer listening to reviews and putting in stuff to make things better - so it's a recommend IF you like tough games and maybe have a controller too!

If you're looking for a review you've come to the wrong place, if you're here to cook a pie then read on !
Napoleon from the final puff pastry
You will need:
Ready flaky pastry - 1.5 kg five eggs Flour - 150 g> Sugar - 400 grams Milk - 1200 ml Vanilla sugar - 1 n. Cognac - 1 tbsp. l. Shelled walnuts - glass sequence of preparation: dough defrost naturally at room temperature (defrost time indicated on the package). Cook the custard: grind the egg yolks with a mixer or a whisk to a conventional incandescent and vanilla sugar, flour and brandy to enter the mix. The mixture pour a trickle of milk, stir and cook, stirring constantly. Divide the dough into the desired number of pieces that will later Korzh. Roll out each piece on a board sprinkled with flour. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes until golden color on a dry baking temperature of 200 degrees. Fluff the cooled cream cakes. If desired, each layer sprinkled with chopped nuts. On top of the cake lightly press smeared with cream and sprinkle all sides crumbs. Add layer cake in a cool place overnight.

reviewText: I'm the guy whose vid the dev has been posting links to. The game tags and description of this game DO say that it's a difficult game. Level 4 was indeed the hardest level I've played in the game thus far. Here's the thing though: I like games where I can't just breeze through and go on a huge rampage. I like games that challenge me a bit. I guess I just like to persevere through things and feel a higher sense of accomplishment upon completing the challenge. If you feel so put off by a game that actually presents a challenge, I'm sorry you had to spend a whole dollar on the game. I will continue to press on through this game and have fun with it!\nAnd no, I had no clue who the developer of this game was prior to downloading and playing the game.

reviewText:
I really wanted to like this game, but in its current state, I cannot recommend it. I wrote some suggestions for the dev a month and a half ago since he appears to be active in the community discussions, but he has not addressed them despite responding to the posts above and below mine.

What's sad is there is quite a bit of content here that most people will never see because the game is unfair with regard to taking damage. There is no delay between taking multiple hits, so falling in spikes will literally kill your three hearts in about 1 second. The lack of proper controller support is also a complete turn-off. You shouldn't need a third-party tool when the Unity engine supports controllers already.

If you're really stubborn, you can get through this game. But it's not an enjoyable experience in its current state. I do hope that this game is updated at some point and I can change my review.

reviewText:
Blaster Shooter GunGuy is certainly not a worst game on Steam.
But make no mistake - this is not a I Wanna Be The Guy fangame or a megaman game.
What you have is a not very nicely balanced platformer with couple simple frustrating mechanics that are, unfortunately, do not get enjoyable when you learn them.
On the upside, game is pretty short and have trading cards, so you will probably make your money back eventually if you obtained the game on a big sale or through a bundle.

P.S.: If you want a difficult platformer that is enjoyable, check out Delicious Fruit community to learn more about better games that this game claims to get inspiration from. Oh, and they all are free, so that's nice, right?

reviewText:
Personally, I dislike rage games like this one. To some degree they're plausible, but I really hate when the game is designed is continuously screwing me over. I jumped to get a chicken before it fell into the pit, the food has collision and I fell because of it. What the f.

If I struggled in some stage and later I nailed it, didn't give me a good feeling, but one of relief that that stage was no more.

Ugly font, the gun is almost useless later on or a pain to kill enemies and yeah, I raged. fml.

reviewText:
Will admit: Came into this with a negative mindset. Any time a game says that they're inspired by IWBTG, that's usually a giant red flag. Still, had the trading card money, figured it'd be funny bad, at least.

I was wrong.

You play as GunGuy, who's apparently looking for his dad or something, but this is never brought up in game. You go through 7 worlds to accomplish this task. You can do three things: Jump, shoot, and dash. The dash propels you forward at high speeds, and is needed to make difficult jumps. It's also one of the least controllable dashes I've ever used. This ain't a Mega Man X dash, let me tell you.

You dash so quickly and it's difficult to have precise control over it, meaning you'll overshoot your jumps and end up falling onto spikes, enemies, or pits. Not that jumping normally is that much better:  You can't control the height of your jump, so you'll hit your head on ceilings and other obstacles nonstop. Momentum is really floaty and strange.

Shooting works fine: Follows Mega Man rules, even looks like the Mega Buster shot. However, you'll soon learn that you don't want to fight anything if you can help it. Enemies are extremely durable and numerous. It's usually better just to avoid them, unless they're one of the many small, fast flying enemies that chase you, or they are directly in your way.

Unusual for this kind of game, you have a health bar: You can survive three hits before you have to restart the stage. There's no checkpoints or anything, and some of the later levels get quite long. The only way to restore health in stages is to collect chicken from fallen enemies...complete with a pretty annoying sound clip every time you pick some up. However, chicken stops spawning in the later stages, meaning you have no way to recover health at all.

The level design feels very lazy at points: Time and time again, I found myself going through obstacles that have been used several times before, in the exact same positioning that they were in before. Just a good ol' copy-paste from one level to the next. Again, this becomes more apparent the further on you get in the game.

In each of the stages, there are gems you can collect. These provide you with money, which unlocks more characters. The new characters don't have any unique abilities, they just provide a slightly different sprite. There are also bonus stages you can play to unlock more characters, if that's your fancy.

Lazy level design is one thing, but the bosses are some of the absolute worst I've ever fought. They fluctuate between being pathetically easy, to them being nearly impossible, and requiring good RNG to win. See that orange guy in the screenshots? What's not shown is how fast that thing attacks, how large the hitboxes are, and how unwieldy the springs are. Other bosses have attacks that can track you across the entire screen, and it's all due to RNG working against you.

It's one thing to have a boss that's hard. It's another to have a boss where I win purely out of luck. Outside of that, the game isn't that hard, the only parts I had any trouble was against said RNG bosses and some bad level design parts, like putting a column of invisible block platforms right under one another, and making it a extreme pain to jump around them if you don't jump in advance.

The real draw to games like these is frustrating, but good level and boss design, and this game lacks both of those qualities. Certainly doesn't look or sound good, either.

To top it all off, there's no ending. When you beat the final boss, you just have to manually quit the game. Maybe there's an ending for clearing it 100%, but...no.

Do not recommend.

reviewText:
Sound:
Boring nothing really stands out.
Graphics:
The graphics are old school retro style. I’m a fan of retro graphics but this looked very basic.
Gameplay:
Side scrolling platform, lots of jumps, avoid spikes and creatures.
Replay value:
I didn’t see a reason for someone to play again, didn’t see anything to collect or unlocks to get.
My Opinion:
I really didn’t like this game, and I’m not sure how or why I acquired it. The game seemed to be very quickly made and I just couldn’t get past the boring gameplay. The game needs a lot more to stand out, such as better graphics, different players and power ups to start.

reviewText: Funny enough, I seem to be having the complete opposite problem of everyone else. As a masochist of gaming, I was looking forward to this, but I find this game to be too easy. For a game to be compared to IWBTG, I was expecting the worst, but this is actually pretty underwhelming. Maybe it'll get harder, I've only beaten the first two worlds (In about 20 minutes) so far, but from what I've played it's not too impressive. The gameplay is solid, but everything else kinda falls flat. The graphics are flat, the music is just one very short loop throughout the whole world, and the bosses are kinda lame. The second boss almost literally didn't do anything to me. Only once he dropped 3 giant apples at me, but I was able to avoid them without even moving. The levels can be pretty short and I found myself just dashing through most of them. There aren't any real obstacles or challenges, just a few spikes and enemies here and there with the occasional cannons. Again for a game to be compared to IWBTG I was expecting very tight jumps, hazards everywhere, very quick deaths, etc. My main issue though is the controls. SPACE jumps, SHIFT dashes, WASD moves, and LEFT CLICK shoots. It may not sound too bad but it's murder on your fingers especially for a game like this. Would have been so much better if the arrow keys moved, Z jumps, X shoots, and SHIFT dashes. Or at the very least an option to remap the controls would have been super nice! Also, this doesn't affect my review in any way, but some achievements would be great for a game that claims to be super hard because it gives you something to show off your hard work for. This game isn't BAD. For .98 it's pretty great fun, but it does need a lot of polishing up. As of right now I can't recommend it though.
